titleStmt.title: State-maxims, or, Certain dangerous positions, destructive to the very natural right and liberty of mankind. Laid down in a book entituled, The grounds of government and obedience; by Tho. White Gent. / Discussed, and both by Scripture and reason confuted, by Will Ball Esq;

titleStmt.title: State-maxims, or, Certain dangerous positions, destructive to the very natural right and liberty of mankind. Laid down in a book entituled, The grounds of government and obedience; by Tho. White Gent. / Discussed, and both by Scripture and reason confuted, by Will Ball Esq;
titleStmt.author: Ball, William.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by G. Dawson, for T. Brewster at the three Bibles at the west-end of Pauls,

notesStmt.note: A reply to: White, Thomas. The grounds of obedience and government.
Annotation on Thomason copy: "7ber [i.e. September] 5th"; 5 in imprint date written over with "6".
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
